Package com.payd.shooti.gamemap.proceduralgeneration.proceduralroom

Class ProceduralRoom

java.lang.Object
com.payd.shooti.math.Bounds
com.payd.shooti.entities.BoundsEntity
com.payd.shooti.entities.SimpleEntity
com.payd.shooti.gamemap.GameMapRoom
com.payd.shooti.gamemap.proceduralgeneration.proceduralroom.ProceduralRoom
All Implemented Interfaces:
IBackgroundable, IBoundsObject, ICanShader, IDispose, IGameMapChild, IGameObject, IRender, IUpdate
public class ProceduralRoom extends GameMapRoom
Represents a room that is generated procedurally. Consumed a BiMap object which represents a datamap of the room tiling.

The BiMap object is a map of x, y coordinates to tile types. For example, dataMap.get(0, 10) would return the EProceduralRoomTileType of the tile at x=0 & y=10.
See Also:
  • ProceduralRoomGenerator

    • setDiscoverable

      public void setDiscoverable(boolean discoverable, boolean rehideable)
      Setting this flag to true implies that the room is not discovered by default, and checks will run to see if the player is within any of the child rooms.
      Parameters:
      discoverable - Whether the room is discoverable or not. Whether player discovered checks should run.
      rehideable - Whether the room can be hidden again after being discovered via the player not being present in any child rooms.

    • setDiscoverable

      public void setDiscoverable(boolean discoverable)
